intro: Plexipus hanningtonii, commonly known as the Hannington's plexipus, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking violet to purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate species with limited distribution.
